Content_wSideColumn.BodyCopy:
The Career Workshop Series is a series of 6 workshops designed to help you achieve your career goals. The following areas are covered:

  • Discovering Your Future Career - identifying your strengths, goals and resources, writing power statements and "Me in 30 Seconds" statements
  • Preparing For and Competing In the Job Market - understanding academic preparation, identifying technical and soft skills (including etiquette and online presence) necessary to present professional image
  • Writing Resumes, Cover Letters & Other Professional Documents - communicating your value to employers, experience providers, and graduate schools through stellar documents, writing effective bullets
  • Networking & Other Job Search Strategies - identifying effective job search skills and techniques, expanding and using your network, improving "Me in 30 Seconds" statements
  • Interviewing & Accepting the Job Offer - mastering typical interview questions by using power statements, "Me in 30 Seconds" statements and STAR stories, dressing for credibility, accepting & negotiating an offer
  • Succeeding in Your Internship, Grad School & Career - pursuing opportunities, working well & building relationships, understanding key resources, planning for ongoing professional development

The workshops are taught on Tuesdays, some Wednesdays and some Saturdays throughout the semester.

Get a schedule of the workshops.

Past Participant Responses

"Everyone should go through the Career Workshop...I was prepared for interviewing by learning about Power Statements and feedback from the videotaping of my mock interviews...The network group meetings motivated me when I was discouraged to go out and get involved in civic organizations, as a matter of fact, that is how I found the lead to my current job."
-Participant from Utah

"I have shared and used the techniques that were taught at the workshop to help others. It is a wonderful program that should be shared throughout the church. It will arm an individual with the employment management skills needed to actively manage their careers and make them self-sufficient in this area of concern."
-Participant from Denver

Registration

Register for the Career Workshop Series using Career Navigator:

  • Login to Career Navigator.
  • Click on the 'Events' tab.
  • Click on the 'Workshops' tab.
  • Select the session you are interested in attending and click the 'RSVP' button to confirm.

Dress for the Career Workshop is business casual.

To cancel your reservation and/or change to a different date, follow the instructions above, and you can click the RSVP button to cancel/change.
